intro: Erlangea subcordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf erlangea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
